column4: i'm trying to install vmware, and i need the "C header files that match your running", i installed linux-headers-2.6.15-26-386 and uname -a gives me "2.6.15-26-386 #1 PREEMPT", i point vmware to /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.15-26/include but vmware complains that these headers don't match my kernel, any pointers?
gimme a second
there are virtual packages that rely on the latest kernels, and kernel headers
there is a package called linux-kernel-headers
oh

The directory of kernel headers (version 2.6.15-26) does not match your running kernel (version 2.6.15-26-386).  Even if the module were to compile successfully, it would not load into the running kernel.
what CPU do you have?

apt-get install linux-headers-k7
